styleName.name: Article title
styleName.description: TItle should be Sentence case

styleName.name: Article title
styleName.description: "Genus names should be given in full at the first instance in the title. And it should be in sentence case with italicized (Eg. Staphylococcus aureus)"

styleName.name: Article title
styleName.description: Semicolons are normally better changed to colons.

styleName.name: Article title: Style
styleName.description: As author provided, no full stops (ie if full first name or initials, leave as author provides)

styleName.name: Article title: Style
styleName.description: Numbered subtitles are not allowed for pairs/series of papers unless all the papers in the set are submitted for simultaneous publication.

styleName.name: Authors
styleName.description: Style: As author provided, use full stops (ie if full first name or initials, leave as author provides), initials spaced (e.g. Gerald F. L. Bills1)

styleName.name: Authors: Affiliation designators
styleName.description: Affiliation designators should appear in numbers (superscript), in sequence, comma separated with no space between comma and number if there is more than one affiliation. Use comma as a separator for author names (e.g. Yongqiang H. Tian6,7, Bo Liu8 )

styleName.name: Affiliation designators
styleName.description: Affiliation: Superscript number precedes each new address. Each address must be in a separate paragraph, even if only the department differs

styleName.name: Affiliations
styleName.description: Addresses may be either in English or in other language; the country name must always be given in English (e.g. Spain, not España)

styleName.name: Affiliations
styleName.description: England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland can be left as such if the author used, but should not be added. England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland must always be followed by UK (not United Kingdom)

styleName.name: Affiliations
styleName.description: "Change United States of America to USA change United Kingdom to UK change China to PR China Federal Republic of Germany to Germany Taiwan to Taiwan, ROC Korea to Republic of Korea SAr to Hong Kong, SAR"

styleName.name: Affiliations
styleName.description: Commas are not used between postcodes and the geographical entity that they refer to, or between street numbers and street names

styleName.name: Affiliations
styleName.description: Order of affiliation: Center, Laboratory, Department, Faculty, Institution, School, University, City, Country. Affiliations without departments are allowed

styleName.name: Present address
styleName.description: Present address: is in bold but the preceding symbol is not (and has no space after it). There should be a full stop at the end of the address.

styleName.name: Headings level 1
styleName.description: Remove end punctuation

styleName.name: Footnotes
styleName.description: "The footnotes are tagged by symbols. Hierarchy of symbols : †, ‡, §, ¶, ||. The symbols (which are not superscripts) follow any superscript numbers (e.g. Bo Liu8†)"

styleName.name: Abbreviations
styleName.description: The Abbreviations: label is in bold. Non-standard abbreviations (see journal’s Information for Authors) should normally be defined here. If the author has not supplied a list of abbreviations, it should be compiled by the copy-editor. The abbreviations are should arranged alphabetically. If there is only one abbreviation, change ‘Abbreviations’ to ‘Abbreviation’ at the beginning of the footnote.

styleName.name: General style: US or UK English consistent throughout individual article
styleName.description: Consistency to be determined based on the total number of US/UK words used in the article.

styleName.name: Headings level 2
styleName.description: Sentence case

styleName.name: Headings level 3
styleName.description: Sentence case

styleName.name: Headings level 4
styleName.description: Sentence case

styleName.name: Headings level 5
styleName.description: Sentence case
Remove head label

styleName.name: Headings level 1
styleName.description: Sentence case

styleName.name: Acknowledgement heading
styleName.description: Sentence case

styleName.name: Author Degree
styleName.description: Mark author degree as deleted
remove dot at end of captions

styleName.name: Figure Label
styleName.description: Format: Fig. 1.
Add dot at end of captions

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: Number in words to digit

styleName.name: Figure Citations
styleName.description: Capital F e.g. see Fig. 2

styleName.name: Figure supplements/Source data Citations
styleName.description: First F capitalised e.g. see Figure 2—figure supplement 1, Figure 2—source data 1

styleName.name: Table Label
styleName.description: Format: Table 1.

styleName.name: Table Head
styleName.description: Table head should be in sentence case

styleName.name: Table Citations
styleName.description: Capital T e.g. see Table 1

styleName.name: Reference citation, General Style
styleName.description: First author surname followed by et al. followed by comma then year of publication, all in brackets e.g. (Smith et al., 1996)

styleName.name: Reference citation, Single author
styleName.description: (Gabriel, 2000)

styleName.name: Reference citation, Two authors
styleName.description: (Mathes and Severa, 2004)

styleName.name: Reference citation, In press
styleName.description: (Johnson et al., in press)

styleName.name: Hyphenation: Em dash
styleName.description: Used in figure supplements eg Figure 1—figure supplement 1.

styleName.name: Commas: Serial commas (Oxford comma)
styleName.description: As author provides as long as consistent in article.

styleName.name: Italicization: Genus and species italicised, follow author in other cases
styleName.description: Capital with full stop, italics, e.g. E. coli. Genus should be provided on first use in main text and thereafter abbreviated to first letter and full stop. If only Genus is provided, still use italics [this is applicable for Table and Figure captions). If both genus and species are given, use only abbreviated genus names with species in tables and figures (exceptions: For S. Typhi, S. Typhimurium, Drosophila, and Arabidopsis add an author query as to whether some or all instances should be Roman or italicised, but we should not autocorrect to italic (since on some occasions the change will be wrong - genus or species).

styleName.name: Temperature
styleName.description: change seconds or second to s

styleName.name: Percentage
styleName.description: Change minute to min

styleName.name: SI Units
styleName.description: 1 week, 2 weeks

styleName.name: SI Units
styleName.description: 2 m not 2 metres

styleName.name: Volume
styleName.description: Change mg/ml (etc.) to mg ml^-1 (etc.)

styleName.name: Percentage
styleName.description: change volume to vol

styleName.name: Volume
styleName.description: change volumes to vols

styleName.name: Weight
styleName.description: And do not add 2unit spaces on present of "mol%"

styleName.name: Magnification
styleName.description: change hours or hour to h

styleName.name: Repetition of units
styleName.description: To indicate ranges of numbers, e.g. 25–40

styleName.name: Range
styleName.description: En-dashes for ranges, 30–90% not 30%–90%

styleName.name: Probability
styleName.description: p lowercase, roman, leading zero, p=0.01.

styleName.name: Spacing
styleName.description: Space around operational symbols, d = 1.278, η = 0.0023.

styleName.name: Spacing
styleName.description: Space between value and percentage, 20 (30%)

styleName.name: Temperature
styleName.description: change seconds or second to s

styleName.name: Temperature
styleName.description: change seconds or second to s

styleName.name: Temperature
styleName.description: change seconds or second to s

styleName.name: Use of &
styleName.description: No ‘&’ allowed, use ‘and’ throughout

styleName.name: Numbers lower than 10
styleName.description: Spell out unless with unit, in which case numerals

styleName.name: Ordinals
styleName.description: only ordinals first through ninth spelled out, 10th onwards

styleName.name: Fold words
styleName.description: Whole numbers: fourfold; fractions: 2.5-fold

styleName.name: Fold words
styleName.description: Whole numbers: fourfold; fractions: 2.5-fold

styleName.name: Foreign Words
styleName.description: Remove italics

styleName.name: Foreign Words
styleName.description: Remove italics

styleName.name: Foreign Words
styleName.description: Remove italics

styleName.name: Linked footnote
styleName.description: Linked footnote to general footnote

styleName.name: Table footnote
styleName.description: Change abbrev footnote innerpunctuation

styleName.name: Table footnote
styleName.description: Change abbrev footnote End punctuation

styleName.name: Abbreviation
styleName.description: Lower case with full stops, (e.g., i.e.). Exception: etc (e.g., i.e. and etc only allowed in parentheses; in main text must spell out (for example, that is, and so on)) Do not automatically change that is to i.e. in parentheses during preediting.

styleName.name: Parentheses
styleName.description: Round with square if within the round brackets ([]).

styleName.name: Geography: United States
styleName.description: In text as author provides (US or, USA, United States, no full stops). Author affils - leave as provided in metadata, United States.

styleName.name: Geography: United Kingdom
styleName.description: In text as author provides (UK or United Kingdom, no full stops). Author affils - leave as provided in metadata, United Kingdom [this is applicable in affiliation also].

styleName.name: Geography: US States
styleName.description: As author provides. In manufacturer details use 2 letter state code (eg TX, no full stops).

styleName.name: Time and dates: Date
styleName.description: "UK version 19 August 1995; US version August 19, 1995. To be used according to style of article – US or UK English. Not '97".

styleName.name: Source of materials: Style
styleName.description: (Product; company, city, country) For Unites States include state as well use 2 letter state code (eg TX, no full stops).

styleName.name: Source of materials: Others
styleName.description: Delete trademark, registered and copyright symbols.

styleName.name: Abbreviation: First use
styleName.description: Define, with abbreviation in brackets. Redefine if abbreviation used in abstract, figure, tables, etc (ie anything with it's own DOI).

styleName.name: Abbreviation: In Figures
styleName.description: Allowed. Define in legend. Redefine previously used abbreviations in legends. e.g., i.e. and etc allowed in abbreviated form in legends.

styleName.name: Abbreviation: In Table
styleName.description: Allowed but define in footnotes.

styleName.name: Abbreviation: Latin abbreviations
styleName.description: Lower case with full stops, (e.g., i.e.). Exception: etc (e.g., i.e. and etc only allowed in parentheses; in main text must spell out (for example, that is, and so on)). Do not automatically change that is to i.e. in parentheses during preediting.

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: Use commas in 4 digit numbers and above e.g. 42,980. But if author changes it on proof stage we allow then to remove as long as consistent

styleName.name: ET AL
styleName.description: Add italics

styleName.name: PRIME
styleName.description: Add italics

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: Use commas in 4 digit numbers and above e.g. 42,980. But if author changes it on proof stage we allow then to remove as long as consistent

styleName.xpath: //span[@data-tag-desc='SPELL'][not( substring(., string-length(.) - 2)='ize' or substring(., string-length(.) - 3)='izes' or substring(., string-length(.) - 3)='ized' or substring(., string-length(.) - 2)='iza' or substring(., string-length(.) - 6)='ization' or substring(., string-length(.) - 3)='izae' or substring(., string-length(.) - 4)='izaes' or substring(., string-length(.) - 4)='izing' )]
styleName.name: SPELL
styleName.description: Spell check

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: To change highlighted spelling in table

styleName.name: Table footnote
styleName.description: To change highlighted spelling in table foot note

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: Use commas in 4 digit numbers and above e.g. 42,980. But if author changes it on proof stage we allow then to remove as long as consistent

styleName.name: Number Format
styleName.description: Use commas in 4 digit numbers and above e.g. 42,980. But if author changes it on proof stage we allow then to remove as long as consistent

styleName.name: Float Number Format
styleName.description: Always use leading zero (ie 0.01)

styleName.name: Number Comparison
styleName.description: Use commas in 4 digit numbers and above e.g. 42,980. But if author changes it on proof stage we allow then to remove as long as consistent

styleName.name: Double quote
styleName.description: Always use single quote

styleName.name: Double quote
styleName.description: Always use single quote

styleName.name: Month
styleName.description: Do not abbreviate month, e.g. February.

styleName.name: Symbols
styleName.description: Registration, trademark symbol should be removed

styleName.name: ET AL
styleName.description: Remove dot
To remove bold

styleName.name: PartLabel
styleName.description: Part label mention in figure caption must in uppercase

styleName.name: Funding Para
styleName.description: merge all funding page to one page

div.p: The author(s) declare that there are no conflicts of interest.
The author(s) received no specific grant from any funding agency.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: Please check that the author names and affiliation details are correct.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: Please add an abbreviations list for your article using the "Add abbreviation" option.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: It has been noted that your Supplementary Material has been uploaded to figshare. If your supplementary material has been uploaded to the Microbiology Society figshare account and changes to the files are required, please upload any updated files in response to this query.

styleName.name: Typeset Tables
styleName.description: Table setting mechanism

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: Please compile abbreviation list for this article.
styleName.description: Query for abbreviation
Add dot at end of captions

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: It has been noted that your Supplementary Material has been uploaded to figshare. If your supplementary material has been uploaded to the Microbiology Society figshare account and changes to the files are required, please upload any updated files in response to this query.

styleName.name: addQuery
styleName.function: This journal has recently changed its design to a single-column format. Please check the display of the figures throughout the PDF proof, to ensure they have been sized appropriately for their content and readability in the new format.
